Package gw.api.exception

Class ErrorInfo

java.lang.Object
gw.api.exception.MessageFragment
gw.api.exception.ErrorDetail
gw.api.exception.ErrorInfo
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
RequestErrorInfo
public class ErrorInfo extends ErrorDetail implements Serializable
This class is the container for error information, it's basically an ErrorDetail with additional information for turning the error into a response, either soap fault or http response. This class uses a builder pattern to simplify capturing the information:
info = new ErrorInfo("My.ResourceKey").with("Prop1",null).with("Prop2",null).withCause(t).withHttpStatus(400);
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • RETRY_NOW

      public static String RETRY_NOW
      This string constant is the xml duration of zero seconds. This represents that the request could be resubmitted immediately and will likely succeed. An example is a ConcurrentDataChangeException, resubmitting the request will fetch the new bean versions, so the request will succeed.

    • RETRY_IN_AN_HOUR

      public static String RETRY_IN_AN_HOUR
      This string constant is the xml duration of one hour. So represents something like a service required by this request is temporarily unavailable or some throttling of requests for performance or security reasons.

    • RETRY_TOMORROW

      public static String RETRY_TOMORROW
      This string constant is the xml duration of one day.

  • Method Details

    • withHttpStatus

      public ErrorInfo withHttpStatus(int status)
      This method will set the status before throwing. This status will be part of the rest response and will be in the serialized error information. By default the http status is HttpServletResponse.SC_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR.
      Parameters:
      status - the status use HttpServletResponse.SC_ values for clarity
      Returns:
      this

    • getHttpStatus

      public int getHttpStatus()
      This method will return the HttpStatus. (see HttpServletResponse)
      Returns:
      the status

    • withFaultCode

      public ErrorInfo withFaultCode(@NotNull gw.xml.ws.WsdlFault.FaultCode value)
      This method will set the soap fault (see WsdlFault.FaultCode} before throwing. The soap fault is part of the wsdl fault sent. And will be in the serialized error information. By default this is Receiver.
      Parameters:
      value - the fault
      Returns:
      this

    • getFaultCode

      public gw.xml.ws.WsdlFault.FaultCode getFaultCode()
      This method returns the fault code (see WsdlFault.FaultCode}
      Returns:
      the fault code

    • withErrorCode

      public ErrorInfo withErrorCode(@NotNull @NotNull String errorCode)
      This method will set the error code. The error code will be part of the soap fault message (the faultSubCode on soap1.2) and included in the serialized error information.
      Parameters:
      errorCode - an error code, typically the exception class name
      Returns:
      this

    • getErrorCode

      public String getErrorCode()
      This method gets the error code (it is also used as soap 1.2 fault sub code)
      Returns:
      the error code

    • withDetail

      public ErrorInfo withDetail(@NotNull @NotNull ErrorDetail detail)

      Parameters:
      detail - the detail
      Returns:
      this

    • withDevMessage

      public ErrorDetail withDevMessage(@NotNull @NotNull MessageFragment message)
      Description copied from class: ErrorDetail
      This method will set the developer message for this error. Typically this will use chaining and the builder pattern like:
      new ErrorDetail().withMessage("Invalid xml")
      .withDevMessage(new MessageFragment()
      .withMessage(saxE.toString()));
      Overrides:
      withDevMessage in class ErrorDetail
      Parameters:
      message - the developer message
      Returns:
      this

    • withCause

      public ErrorInfo withCause(@NotNull @NotNull Throwable cause)
      Description copied from class: ErrorDetail
      This method will set the cause for this specific detail. There maybe only one cause for each detail object.
      Overrides:
      withCause in class ErrorDetail
      Parameters:
      cause - the exception that cause this error
      Returns:
      this

    • with

      public ErrorInfo with(@NotNull @NotNull String propName, Object value)
      Description copied from class: MessageFragment
      This method will add a property for this message. There can be multiple properties. If this object uses a display key, the property values will be passed as arguments to the DisplayKey to create the message string in the order they are defined. Also, properties will be serialized with the error information in subclass (see ErrorDetail and ErrorInfo
      Overrides:
      with in class ErrorDetail
      Parameters:

      value - the value of the property

    • with

      public ErrorInfo with(@NotNull @NotNull String propName, Object value, @NotNull Property.SpecialHandling specialHandling)
      Description copied from class: MessageFragment
      This method will add a property for this message. There can be multiple properties. If this object uses a display key, the property values will be passed as arguments to the DisplayKey to create the message string in the order they are defined. Also, properties will be serialized with the error information in subclass (see ErrorDetail and ErrorInfo This method also permits setting special handling (see Property.SpecialHandling) for the added property.
      Overrides:
      with in class ErrorDetail
      Parameters:
      propName - the name of the property
      value - the value of the property
      specialHandling - any special handling desired for the property
      Returns:
      this

    • withRetryableInPeriod

      public ErrorInfo withRetryableInPeriod(String retryableInPeriod)
      This method will set the retry period before throwing. This should be an xml duration The time interval is specified in the following form "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS" where:

      P indicates the period (required) nY indicates the number of years nM indicates the number of months nD indicates the number of days T indicates the start of a time section (required if you are going to specify hours, minutes, or seconds) nH indicates the number of hours nM indicates the number of minutes nS indicates the number of seconds

      Parameters:
      retryableInPeriod - the retryable period.
      Returns:
      this

    • withRetryableNow

      public ErrorInfo withRetryableNow()
      This method will set the retry duration before throwing.
      Returns:
      this

    • getRetryableInPeriod

      public String getRetryableInPeriod()
      The method will return retryable duration. See w3c duration for the structure
      Returns:
      the string
